intro: Parinari congolana, commonly known as African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in moist lowland forests and is valued for its hard, durable wood. Parinari congolana also has medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
